sentence.Network_en: Love makes one overcome the sense of isolation and separateness.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱可以使人战胜孤独和分离之感.

sentence.Network_en: This article demonstrates that this separateness is temporary, relative and conditional.
sentence.Network_cn: 但电子文件信息与载体的分离是暂时的, 是相对的和有条件的.

sentence.Network_en: The ego is an illusion, separateness, and trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 自我(ego)是一个幻觉, 分离, 及烦恼.

list.abs: 分字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 分局〖 suboffice;subbureau〗 分开〖 separate;divide〗 分科〖 departmentation〗.
-tion后缀 ... preparation 准备,预备 separation 分离,分开 celebration 庆祝(会),庆典.
中国特色词的译法 - Billwang 工业设计论坛 ... divorced 离异 separated 分居 number of children 子女人数.
有关环境污染的英语词汇 ... scrubbers 洗涤器 separators 分离器 smoke prevention 防烟.

entry.def: If one thing is separate from another, there is a barrier, space, or division between them, so that they are clearly two things.

example.ex: Each villa has a separate sitting-room...
example.tran: 每栋别墅都有一间独立的起居室。

example.ex: They are now making plans to form their own separate party...
example.tran: 他们如今正计划组建自己的独立政党。

entry.def: If you refer to separate things, you mean several different things, rather than just one thing.

example.ex: Use separate chopping boards for raw meats, cooked meats, vegetables and salads...
example.tran: 切生肉、熟肉、蔬菜和拌色拉的青菜时要使用不同的切菜板。

example.ex: Men and women have separate exercise rooms...
example.tran: 男女有各自的健身房。

entry.def: If you separate people or things that are together, or if they separate, they move apart.

example.ex: Police moved in to separate the two groups...
example.tran: 警方介入进来，将两拨人分开。

example.ex: The pans were held in both hands and swirled around to separate gold particles from the dirt...
example.tran: 双手握住淘选盘不停旋动将沙金和尘土分开。

entry.def: If you separate people or things that have been connected, or if one separates from another, the connection between them is ended.

example.ex: They want to separate teaching from research...
example.tran: 他们想把教学和研究分开。

example.ex: It's  very possible that we may see a movement to separate the two parts of the country...
example.tran: 很可能我们会目睹一场分裂该国这两个地区的运动。

entry.def: If a couple who are married or living together separate, they decide to live apart.

example.ex: Her parents separated when she was very young...
example.tran: 她很小的时候父母就分居了。

example.ex: Since I separated from my husband I have gone a long way.
example.tran: 自从我和我丈夫分开后，我的生活发生了很大的变化。

entry.def: An object, obstacle, distance, or period of time which separates two people, groups, or things exists between them.

example.ex: ...the white-railed fence that separated the yard from the paddock...
example.tran: 将院子和小围场隔开的白色围栏

example.ex: They had undoubtedly made progress in the six years that separated the two periods...
example.tran: 毫无疑问，他们在这两个时期相隔的 6 年间取得了进展。

entry.def: If you separate one idea or fact from another, you clearly see or show the difference between them.

example.ex: It is difficult to separate legend from truth...
example.tran: 很难将传说和事实区别开来。

example.ex: ...learning how to separate real problems from imaginary illnesses...
example.tran: 学习如何分辨真实的和想象出的疾病

entry.tran: 使得以区分;使获得区别
entry.def: A quality or factor that separates one thing from another is the reason why the two things are different from each other.

example.ex: The single most important factor that separates ordinary photographs from good photographs is the lighting...
example.tran: 区分普通照片和出色照片的一个至关重要的因素就是光线。

example.ex: What separates terrorism from other acts of violence?
example.tran: 恐怖主义和其他暴力行为的区别是什么？

entry.tran: (两个参赛队或竞争者比分)相隔，相差
entry.def: If a particular number of points separate two teams or competitors, one of them is winning or has won by that number of points.

example.ex: In the end only three points separated the two teams.
example.tran: 最终两队只相差 3 分。

entry.def: If you separate a group of people or things into smaller elements, or if a group separates, it is divided into smaller elements.

example.ex: The police wanted to separate them into smaller groups...
example.tran: 警察想把他们拆散成几小股。

example.ex: Wallerstein's work can be separated into three main component themes...
example.tran: 沃勒斯坦的作品可以细分成3个主要的主题。

entry.def: Separates are clothes such as skirts, trousers, and shirts which cover just the top half or the bottom half of your body.

entry.tran: 分道扬镳;分手;分路而行
entry.def: When two or more people who have been together for some time go their separate ways, they go to different places or end their relationship.

example.ex: Sue and her husband decided to go their separate ways.
example.tran: 苏和丈夫决定离婚。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being several and distinct
3. the quality of being not alike; being distinct or different from that otherwise experienced or known

auth_sentence.content: This separateness was intensified by the fact that South Boston was so physically isolated.
auth_sentence.res_content: This separateness was intensified by the fact that South Boston was so physically isolated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This separateness was intensified by the fact that South Boston was so physically isolated.

auth_sentence.content: The country's institutions and culture have abetted a widespread sense of Muslim separateness from the national mainstream.
auth_sentence.res_content: The country's institutions and culture have abetted a widespread sense of Muslim separateness from the national mainstream.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The country's institutions and culture have abetted a widespread sense of Muslim separateness from the national mainstream.

auth_sentence.content: But I think it gets to a deeper sense, as well, of separateness.
auth_sentence.res_content: But I think it gets to a deeper sense, as well, of separateness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But I think it gets to a deeper sense, as well, of separateness.
